edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Andrew Nipp GameEngine is where almost everything from the other classes contribute to the game. The GameEngine takes user commands from UserInterface, checks with Player, and then performs the tasks. It is also where the Enemy class performs the actions it decides. GameEngine updates the Grid and retrieves positions from it. GameEngine also checks to see if the Player has picked up any PowerUps or if they have ammo left.

      • userChoice

        private java.lang.String userChoice
        This field holds the choice of the user. There are xx potential values for the user to select: left, right, up, down, shoot, save, exit

      • lookDirection

        private java.lang.String lookDirection
        This field holds the choice of direction for which the user will "look" before each turn. There are four directions: left, right, up, down

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        The default constructor for GameEngine. Currently it is only filling up the instances of the classes and forcing gameOver to be false.

    • Method Detail

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        The main loop of the game, this is where all the checks and actions go. The loop is finished once gameOver is set to be true either from finding the briefcase, the player dying, or the user quitting.

      • performUserAction

        public void performUserAction()
        The method that will take userChoice and perform actions based around it. For example, if the user chooses to move it will call the plrMoveCMD(String) method.

      • plrShootCMD

        public void plrShootCMD()
        The method that will have the player shoot the gun. First it will check to see if the Player has any bullets left. Then it will fire the gun.

      • plrMoveCMD

        public void plrMoveCMD(java.lang.String moveChoice)
        The method that will have the player move It will move the player in the direction specified.
        Parameters:
        moveChoice, - which is the direction the user chooses

      • enemyAttack

        public void enemyAttack()
        The method that will have the Enemy attack the Player.

        The method that will have the Enemy move.

      • setRoomPositions

        public void setRoomPositions()

      • setUserCMD

        public void setUserCMD(java.lang.String lookDir,
                       java.lang.String choice)
        Used to set lookDirection and userChoice.
        Parameters:
        lookDir - - The direction chosen by the user to look, saved to lookDirection
        choice - - The choice of the user saved to a userChoice.
